intro: Kalbfussia simplex, commonly known as the small-flowered bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters, with narrow, grass-like leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Kalbfussia simplex is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and forest edges, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
